page.title: 15PLACES OF INTEREST(cont.d)
page.content: Elmore Court looks over part of the River Severn and part of Elmore . It was built in 1550 . It is owned by the Guise(named as the Digese when they first came to England.) The big gates at the entrance of Elmore Court were made in the early 18th century by William Edney of Bristol . The Guise were mentioned in the last Domesday Book in 1066 with Elmore Court . Mr. Duffield showed us round . Elmore Court is open to the public on the first Sunday of the month from May to September . At school we went on a visit to Elmore Court. It is a large house . I wonder how the Guise don't get lost ! In Elmore Court there is a bedspread and every wife in Elmore embroidered their house on it . As we went down the very old oak cantilever stairs we passed a bear on the end . It was a
